title: Type from the industrial revolution
content:
I have been working on this book project  
_( [http://www.typophile.com/node/60289](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014115340/http:/www.typophile.com/node/60289 "http://www.typophile.com/node/60289"))_  
and I'm looking for a good display font for the title and chapter headings.  
Something from the late 1800's, particularly type coming from the Industrial Revolution. I saw this picture and I have highlighted some type that I feel is close to what I'm looking for. What fonts are these and does anyone have suggestions for something that is similar?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014115340im_/http:/typophile.com/files/american-type-detail_2_4130.jpg)
author: Bloom.Aar

comments.content: You could use [Law Italic](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014115340/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/lanston_type_co/ltc_law_italic_regular/) or [Kilkenny](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014115340/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/ihof/p22_kilkenny_set/) or maybe [Heroine](http://web.archive.org/web/20131014115340/http:/www.fountaintype.com/typefaces/heroine) or any number of fonts available at Letterhead Fonts.
